statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Kealen Ives nailed a 3-pointer with 1:14 left and Rider made seven free throws down the stretch as the Broncs held on to beat Charleston Southern 82-72 on Saturday night.
article.headline: Rider gets 2nd win, beats Charleston Southern 82-72
article.linkText: Rider gets 2nd win, beats Charleston Southern 82-72
article.story: CHARLESTON, S.C. -- Kealen Ives nailed a 3-pointer with 1:14 left and Rider made seven free throws down the stretch as the Broncs held on to beat Charleston Southern 82-72 on Saturday night. Jimmie Taylor, who finished with 19 points, made four of those late free throws. Teddy Okereafor added 16 points and grabbed 11 rebounds as Rider (2-8) won for the first time since beating Houston Baptist 67-56 on Nov. 25. Ives finished with 15 points. Rider was up 21-7 at the midway point in the first half and held a 42-34 halftime advantage. That was Rider's most productive half this year. Rider made 27 of 52 (51.9%) from the floor while limiting the Buccaneers to 25-of-64 shooting. The Buccaneers had closed to 72-68 with 2:34 left. Ives answered with his trey and Rider rode to the win. Raemond Robinson scored all 14 of his points in the second half for the Buccaneers (3-6).
